intro: Anisochilus paniculatus, commonly known as the clustered spikerush, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, cylindrical stems that bear dense clusters of spikelets. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in panicles, which are typically wind-pollinated. It thrives in wetland habitats, including marshes and pond edges, and is often found in temperate regions. Anisochilus paniculatus plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and semi-aquatic organisms.
